Alassane Ouattara , who works for an Islamic NGO in the eastern town of Bondoukou near the Ghana border, said police raided some neighborhoods in response to a standoff between pro-Alassane Ouattara and Gbagbo students the day before. They went to the neighborhood early in the morning and started shooting, he told Reuters by phone, adding that he had helped move the wounded from the scene.`` There was one dead, which I saw, and around nine wounded, seven of them by bullets.''
